short_description: This function is used to categorize the input rows.
long_description: This function is used to categorize the input rows. Each row can be part of multiple groups.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the input table

argument_clauses.name: labels
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies a label for each case. Each case corresponds to a condition, which is a SQL predicate that includes input column names. When an input value satisfies condition, that is a match, and the function outputs the input row and the corresponding label.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies a label for each case. Each case corresponds to a condition, which is a SQL predicate that includes input column names. When an input value satisfies condition, that is a match, and the function outputs the input row and the corresponding label.
